channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Deep pothole at the roundabout going south, 4th December
item.description:
Deep pothole at the roundabout going south, over the days it has increased its depth considerably. It makes cars change their direction when entering the roundabout with a consirable loss of focus on the road situation to avoid damaging your wheels and car.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Granville Road, Fallow Corner, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street Light 139 48 is broken, 4th December
item.description:
The street light is not coming on during the night
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Road, Rotherhithe, Greater London

item.title: Pallets dumped in roadway and on verge, 4th December
item.description:
Numerous pallets dumped on roadway and on verge w/ cardboard

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hailey Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London

item.title: Pothole right after speed bump on the left side coming from the bridge, 4th December
item.description:
Big Pothole is forming right after speed bump on the left side coming from the bridge. It is increasingly dangerous for drivers and people on the pavement if cars are moved towards the left as they go from the bridge towards long lane. Just right after the speed bump after the bridge
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor View, Finchley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The drain at the junction of Corbylands Rd/Merries road has burt, 4th December
item.description:
The drain at Corbylands rd/Merrilees Rd is blocked or burts. The water is running down Corbylands Road and flooding the junction of Corbylands rd in to the second part of Corbylands rd

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Longlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish all over grass, 4th December
item.description:
I’ve reported this so many times when the bins get done on a Wednesday they drop it all over the grass and in the road ! It’s so messy and I’m always trying to clear it on my walk! Please can someone clean the grass areas around prestbury square we already have vermin around this area we don’t need more !!!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Prestbury Square, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A big board perhaps with tiles on it has been dumped on the pavement outside the flats near start of Palmers Road, 4th December
item.description:
There is a big board against the wall outside the flats on Palmers Road near the junction with Bowes Road. It is big and could fall on the school children who walk along here to the various local schools.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Southgate, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside No 55, 4th December
item.description:
A lot of sand and mud from building works along the road coupled with a car parked in one place for nearly 6 months has blocked the drain. Our car is often parked there but can be moved as long as we have notice.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Redington Road, West Hampstead, Greater London

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 86, The Limes Avenue, New Southgate, Greater London

item.title: Gang tag graffiti sprayed onto Bus Shelter information sign, 4th December
item.description:
There is a gang tag graffitied onto the bus information sign at the ‘Rowley Gardens’ Bus Shelter / stop on Green Lanes next to the wooden boundary fence of Finsbury Park. This is obscuring the bus information and needs removing before further gang tags appear. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lanes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (non-offensive)

item.title: Blocked pedestrian pathway for whellchair users, 4th December
item.description:
There are rivate property scaffolding blocking the only and main access to The blackwall lane pathway in the main corner with trafalgar Road and Woolwich Road. Workera did not show permit and did not provide reason for it to be there.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Blackwall Lane, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement impassable, 4th December
item.description:
Builders have dug up the pavement in this development making it nearly impassable for elderly people like me, mothers with prams or anyone with a disability. We have to walk in the road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bromley Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside Denmarkhill Station, 4th December
item.description:
Every time it rains heavy this drain quickly overflows and floods the main entrance to Denmark Hill railway station. Tried unblocking with various items but seems to be unsuccessful. Needs sorting urgently as we sometimes have to shut our main station entrance when raining heavy.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Champion Park, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipping, 4th December
item.description:
The pallets seems to have been there for a couple of weeks. Now more items are being added. This particular spot is used fairly often for fly-tipping. Have reported before for council to do something more permanent but no joy

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Merrow Street, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lorry hasn't moved since august 2025, 4th December
item.description:
It obscures the view of the cycle lane as we exit our property and endangers life. Have previously reported this.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Johns Park, Blackheath
